channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2024 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Devastation in Gaza as Israel wages war on Hamas
item.description: Israel has approved the reopening of the Erez crossing into Gaza, closed since the October 7 Hamas attacks, as well as the Port of Ashdod to allow more aid into the enclave. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Devastation in Gaza as Israel wages war on Hamas
item.description: US President Joe Biden told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a call Thursday that the overall humanitarian situation in Gaza and deaths of aid workers due to Israeli strikes are "unacceptable." Follow here for live updates.

item.title: Boston Marathon Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the Boston Marathon, which is an annual marathon starting in Hopkinton, Massachusetts, and ending at the Boston Public Library.

item.title: Jack Nicholson Fast Facts
item.description: View Jack Nicholson's Fast Facts at CNN and learn more about the Academy Award winning actor.

item.title: Hundreds stranded after deadly 7.4 magnitude quake hits Taiwan
item.description: Rescue teams are trying to reach more than 700 people stranded in eastern Taiwan following the strongest earthquake to hit the island in decades.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description: April 5, 2024

item.title: Syrian Civil War Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts on Syria's Civil War to learn about the on-going conflict, the escalating refugee crisis.

item.title: April 3, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The Israeli airstrike that killed seven aid workers delivering food to civilians in Gaza has prompted global outrage. Follow for live news updates.

item.title: 7.4 magnitude quake hits Taiwan, strongest in 25 years
item.description: A major earthquake has hit the east coast of Taiwan with a magnitude of 7.4, the strongest on the island in 25 years.

item.title: Pete Rose Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Pete Rose and learn about the former Cincinnati Reds player and manager who was banned for life from baseball for gambling.

item.title: Oklahoma City Bombing Fast Facts
item.description: Read Fast Facts from CNN about the bombing of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, on April 19, 1995.

item.title: Antony Blinken Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts on US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

item.title: OPEC Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts for a look at the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries, headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

item.title: Columbine High School Shootings Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts for some background information about the deaths of 13 people at Columbine High School in Littleton, Colorado, on April 20, 1999.

item.title: Bill Gross Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Bill Gross Fast Facts and learn more about the life of the bond expert and billionaire philanthropist.

item.title: April 2, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: An Israeli airstrike has killed at least seven aid workers from a team delivering food to civilians in Gaza, according to nonprofit World Central Kitchen and authorities in the enclave.

item.title: The latest on the 2024 campaign and primary elections
item.description: Former President Trump is campaigning in the key battleground states of Wisconsin and Michigan as another round of primary elections are held Tuesday. Follow here for the latest live news updates.

item.title: April 1, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Iran accused Israel of killing two top commanders and five others in an airstrike on its consulate in Damascus, Syria. Follow for live updates. Follow for live updates.

item.title: What April Fools' Day looks like around the world
item.description: The Scottish used to call it Huntigowk Day. The French use it as an excuse to prank people with fish. Iranians have a version tied to ancient customs. It seems nearly every culture is united by a desire to pull some silly, goofy tricks.

item.title: March 31, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Fierce fighting is taking place across Gaza, where Palestinians face catastrophic levels of hunger due to Israel's throttling of aid during its campaign against Hamas.

item.title: Easter dishes from around the world
item.description: Honey-glazed ham, garlic mashed potatoes and fluffy dinner rolls might be staples at American Easter meals, but around the world, there are many distinct ways to savor the holiday.

item.title: March 30, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Fierce fighting is taking place across Gaza, where Palestinians face catastrophic levels of hunger due to Israel's throttling of aid during its campaign against Hamas.

item.title: March 29, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: High-level talks between US and Israeli officials over Israel's potential military operations in Rafah in southern Gaza could take place as soon as Monday, US officials told CNN.

item.title: March 29, 2024 - Baltimore Key Bridge collapse
item.description: A massive cleanup effort is underway in Baltimore after the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge this week.

item.title: Dow Jones Industrial Average Fast Facts
item.description: Read Fast Facts on CNN to learn about the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

item.title: Michele Bachmann Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts for a look at the life of former US Representative Michele Bachmann.

item.title: Mpox in the United States Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts on mpox, formerly monkeypox, in the United States. The virus was declared a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization. The virus originated in Africa and is the cousin of smallpox.

item.title: North Korea Nuclear Timeline Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's North Korea Nuclear Timeline Fast Facts to learn more about the country's nuclear capabilities and efforts.

item.title: March 28, 2024 - Baltimore Key Bridge collapse
item.description: Officials are moving at "full speed" on several priorities after the collapse of Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge, including reopening the shipping channel and restarting port traffic, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore said at a news conference Thursday.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description: March 29, 2024
